website_summaries.verdict: These earplugs offer supreme protection from loud music at a concert while allowing users to be a part of conversation and enjoy the show.
pros: Set comes with case and 2 pairs of earplugs to ensure the best fit
Comfortable enough to wear for hours at a time without slipping out
Effective in minimizing loudness of music, still allowing easy conversation
cons: Shape of the case is a bit awkward

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a bar that has live music and these were suggested to me. I hate the cheap foam earplugs because you can't hear anything, and I need to hear my customers orders. These dampen the sound just enough to not cause ear damage yet still allow me to hear people speaking to me.
customer_reviews.author: jen...

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. I went to U2 in D
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I went to U2 in D.C. and left with ringing ears for 3 days. I bought these, and went to see U2 in San Diego and had a wonderful experience. I had to shove these babies in deep to get them to work (thus necessitating me using the smaller set). Excellent results and was still able to hear the music in the right key without suffering hearing loss or damage. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Brandoneous

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I didn't notice any difference between these and cheap plugs I got from Target. On top of that, the silicone gets slippery and the plugs end up sliding out of my ears. I've tried them at three concerts, and each time I end up putting my old ear plugs in. I wouldn't waste your money on these overpriced pieces of trash. Nor should you consider the useless connector cord that you have to purchase separately.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier in TX

customer_reviews.title: so having these on my Keychain is super
customer_reviews.text: Allows you to have a conversation in high volume areas I'm an audio engineer and need to protect my ears, so having these on my Keychain is super handy
customer_reviews.author: Qhilip

customer_reviews.title: I'm a rock guitarist that has never found a happy medium between volume and perceived sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm a rock guitarist that has never found a happy medium between volume and perceived sound quality...until now. Eargasms, quite simply, turn the volume down on what you're hearing. There is no muffled, distorted mess that you're likely to get with most foam earplugs, and there is no discomfort that you might get with other noise filters. And being transparent, they're not conspicuous at all. I'm planning to get each of my band members a pair to save what little hearing they have left. I highly recommend Eargasms.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: sounds amazing still
customer_reviews.text: They worked out amazing! Could hear everything at the show but also knew my ears were being protected.
customer_reviews.author: jacky benson

customer_reviews.title: Great protection... great sound
customer_reviews.text: I go to a lot of concerts and hit the age where it was time to worry about my ears. I purchased these and right away went to two concerts one indoor and one outdoors. My ears felt fine after the concerts and the next day for the first time in a long time. The best part is the sound and vocals came in surprisingly clear still. Very happy with this product and will continue to use for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chase DeNamur

customer_reviews.title: Have only used them once so far. They take ...
customer_reviews.text: Have only used them once so far. They take a little getting used to as far as comfort, but after a loud show, I didn't notice any ringing over what I already suffer permanently. That is exactly what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe this is even a product on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this is even a product on the market. I bought these to keep wind noise out of my ears when I ride my motorcycle and they literally don't do anything but sit in your ear. They don't even filter ANY noise whatsoever, I've tried on about 10 occasions now.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to keep on your keychain
customer_reviews.text: I'm a producer and my ears are my most valuable asset. These are amazing earplugs and allow me to hear the full frequency range when I'm at a concert or club, not just the bass like other foam earplugs. They are clear making it very hard for somebody to tell that you have earplugs in. The quality is also top notch, they don't feel flimsy or as if they will break. Most importantly, they come with a nice sized case so I can keep them on my keychain and have them available whenever I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are a must for live shows!
customer_reviews.text: These things were AMAZING!!! I took my oldest son to his first concert which happened to be Metallica and we were on the floor close to the stage and I figured they may muffle the sound from the show. Man was I wrong! We could hear really clear that to the point we did have to move back somewhat for my son. I love the fact that the founder actually reached out to me in an email to see how the product worked. That's VERY rare that people do that these days and it's something I truly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Preserves live sound and keeps your ears safe
customer_reviews.text: A truly innovative product. I go to a lot of concerts. I was irresponsible with my ears growing up, and I have a bit of tinnitus as a result. These allow me to go to as many shows as I want without having to deal with the next-day deafness or long term hearing loss. I am very impressed with their ability to transmit quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with my purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I've been an earplug advocate for well over a decade now... I've tried them all. I purchased eargasm plugs because I like the price point (I lose, misplace, drop earplugs all the time). The filters I'm using are rated -12db and they work great and you can still hear what's going on around you. They fit in my ear perfectly and once they are there, you forget that you're wearing them. The metal case is a nice touch as well. When I lose or misplace one of these, I will not hesitate to buy again. :-)
customer_reviews.author: JJS

customer_reviews.title: Gets to the perfect level of sound immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Solid quality, fast shipping, and great sound. The best way I've found to describe these is that they're mimicking your ears at the end of a concert from the beginning. At the start of a concert the sound is extremely loud, often uncomfortably loud. Over time throughout the concert your ears adjust a bit and by the end of the show everything is at a comfortable sound level. These take you directly to that perfect sound level right away. The concerts are still loud, but never overwhelmingly loud. Taking them out momentarily during a concert is startling.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Farrand

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Being a tinnitus sufferer for decades and using many many ear protection products I tried the eargasm per reviews. Both sizes wouldn't seal properly even after pushing them in as far as possible then they would work there way out. I'd guess they worked out because the little flaps were way to smooth and flattened out upon insertion. The best thing is foam ear plugs, they work every time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Turner

customer_reviews.title: The best earplugs I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Since I got these I've had the chance to use them at loud job sites with construction and alarm testing. They do the job very nicely and are comfortable to use. The tab makes them easy to remove. I will use them again when I attend a loud rock show this Saturday. I'm sure the music will sound great with these. I like them so much I bought a second set for my girlfriend so she won't go deaf from me bringing her to rock concerts. I highly recommend these. Also they come with a special container to store them securely. You can see that you are getting a fine quality product the moment it is in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: survivor030406

customer_reviews.title: According to the packaging, 2 different sets of ear ...
customer_reviews.text: According to the packaging, 2 different sets of ear rubber ear plug housings were supposed to come in the box - 1 large set and 1 small set. I did receive 2 sets of rubber ear housings, however I received 3 large that were large and only 1 that was small. Because of this, I now cannot make use of the rea plugs because the large housings don't stay in my ears - they pop out after a short time wearing them. I need the small plugs, but was not sent 2 of them as was supposed to be in the box.
customer_reviews.author: John N.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I have very sensitive ears but love ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have very sensitive ears but love concerts and these worked perfectly for a music festival I attended. They stayed in my ears and were comfortable. The music did not sound muffled and I was able to enjoy without damaging my ears
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised for me
customer_reviews.text: I've used them briefly playing my acoustic drum kit. The sound level dropped considerably and I could still hear everything amazingly well. I will be using these for live mixing and when attending concerts. They were easy to put in my ears and comfortable. I played for many years in a loud band and have slight hearing loss of high end and could not tell a loss of high fidelity when I had these in. I wish these were available 20 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie N.

customer_reviews.title: Not if you need to hear orders.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not impressed. I bought them because people said you could hear with them in, but I’m a bartender at a live music venue, the cheap earplugs I’ve used work better than these. I can hear the base and tones from the band but I can’t hear anyone screaming at me with these things in. I probably need to dish out the $200+ to get custom fitted for a pair of ear plugs that will do what I need): worth a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: They do the opposite of what they say and they’re too small
customer_reviews.text: Nope. These are horrible. I use the largest tip on my AirPod pros and most other ear pipes to give you an idea of my ear canal size. These don’t fit. They’re too small. Maybe max size is a medium. I did fiddle with them and stuck them so far into my ear that they did create a little bit of seal but these did the opposite. They amplified all sounds. Went for a ride on a motorcycle and my exhaust was deafening with these on. Rode home without them and it was way better. Maybe I’m just weird but these are rubbish.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Have worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I work at a very loud bar with live music most nights of the week. I got these to try to save my hearing. They work wonderfully. Brings the volume down to a manageable level and I am still able to hear people ordering. Now I just need to get used to wearing them in my ears for extended periods.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: if you love your ears, give them an eargasm, or multiple eargasms!
customer_reviews.text: punk rock/ hardcore drummer, suffering from tinnitus and hearing loss. the last 2yrs ive been wearing foam 36db earplugs. my bassist got these at NAMM last year and had nothing but good things to say so i finally tried them. i was surprised by how i could hear my individual drum tones again and my cymbals actually sounded like cymbals, not garbage can lids. i was worried my ears were going to be ringing worse than usual or my hearing may be damaged but no such thing has happened. so i can hear my instrument again, and my hearing isn't suffering. if you're on the fence about buying these, don't waste anymore time and just do it! you're welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Lovely packaging, but neither size fit my ears
customer_reviews.text: I got these and a much cheaper back-up pair ($13 ety plugs) to attend a rock concert. The cheaper earplugs fit me much better, but that may just be me. In order to use the small size plugs included in this box, you need to pull the filter cores out of the large silicone plugs and then transfer them. Even with youtube videos, I struggled initially. I was annoyed when I realized that neither size really fit me well. These are packaged so attractively that your teen will try to steal them if you leave them out (though that does not mean they will actually wear them...).
customer_reviews.author: EDL

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal for concerts and festivals
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I bought these to wear at festivals and concerts. These are phenomenal- they reduce the loudness without hindering sound quality at all. In fact, the first time I wore them I was not actually sure they were working because the music sounded normal. I pulled one out and realized how much louder it was, so I quickly put it back in. I never get ringing in my ears now after shows no matter how loud they are. I would highly recommend these to anyone that goes to live events or concerts. Hearing damage is for life people! Tinnitus does not seem fun. Just spend 30 bucks and get these. Your ears will not regret it
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like ‘em at all. Felt like I had a stick in my ears.
customer_reviews.text: For me and my intended purpose of using these while motorcycling and listening to music from helmet speakers, they were a non-starter. Everyone’s hearing and ear canal shapes are different. I found that these didn’t seal out the wind noise and none of the tips were comfortable. After a few minutes, I couldn’t wait to get my helmet off and pull these things outta my ears. Same on a second pair for my wife. Wasn’t real thrilled that the seller hit me for a 20% restocking fee. Went back to Howard alright Laser Lite foam earplugs. $18 for 200 pairs on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Motorcycle Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: I just bought these because I play in a loud ...
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these because I play in a loud band and have needed to get ear protection. These blew me away and definitely help protect my ears!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Maher

customer_reviews.title: Lost container with earplugs after night of dancing.
customer_reviews.text: Defective product. The container does not secure the earplugs as good as you think. I always make sure I screw the top on tightly when I put them away. I never thought I would lose them this way. Very upsetting. Going back to using disposable foam ones.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I looked at quite a few noise canceling earplugs and decided on these. The packaging is very nice and they look great. But that’s all it is. It comes with 2 sizes and both are much too big for my adult ears. They don’t go in despite me following instructions on how to properly wear them. They just are much too wide. Once you force them in they come out within 20 seconds EVEEY single time. I’m sensitive to noise and thought these would be the perfect solution in my busy life. I definitely over payed. Or worth the money at all.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: These things do exactly what they're supposed to do! I used them when I rode my motorcycle and they blocked out noise, but I could still listen to my music. They're like magic. I had two issues however: I wasn't able to hear my music as well as I wanted to. It was still pretty easy to hear, considering I had earplugs in. Secondly, I ended up giving them to my boyfriend (who also thought they were absolute magic) because neither size fit in my ear. They were extremely painful, actually. My boyfriend has larger ear canals, so they fit great for him.
customer_reviews.author: Marlia

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for my post TBI noise sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: The best product I've used yet for allowing me to hear conversation while reducing the chaotic noise levels of a crowed restaurant that has their stereo up too loud. After my TBI, noise sensitivity has limited what I can do, these again allow me to enjoy a nice meal at my favorite restaurants without impacting my ability to hear conversation. That said, eating with any earplugs means your own speaking (and chewing) volume does increase...but it's worth the price for the benefit. When I first saw the extraction tab I was concerned about ease of use with my kinda large fingers, but they're easy to extract.
customer_reviews.author: I'm Rod, that's all.

customer_reviews.title: Still looking for the right plugs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use while riding a motorcycle. Neither size really felt great in my ears. When compared to foam plugs, I did notice a bit more ambient noise was perceptible while still keeping wind noise to a minimum (this is a good thing). Wind noise reduction is better with foams, though. With foam plugs I honestly can forget I have them in until I get off the bike and everything is muffled. I could always feel these and could never get used to them after 100s of miles. Might be a good option for some but didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: DTS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely in love with these earplugs. I got them for work, my Harley, and concerts. Haven’t gotten to try the last two yet but for work they’ve been incredible. I have been in a plants compressor rooms wiring up some new systems and the noise level requires hearing protection. I used those foam throw aways before and I’d struggle to hear anyone talking (yelling) at me. With these I can have a conversation and still hear small sounds, like paper crinkling or plastic being ripped. Couldn’t be happier. I’ll update if something changes in a few months when it’s warm enough for the motorcycle and my summer festivals start again.
customer_reviews.author: Giles Schoolmeester

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing
customer_reviews.text: So let me start by saying these have exceeded my expectations. I ride a Harley Road Glide and it is loud as heck. I have loud exhaust and a crazy loud stereo. I like to ride and listen to my music but when competing with wind noise motor and exhaust it is unbearable. I tried a different set of earplugs but they cut out all the sound. I used the eargasm earplugs and they are AMAZING! I can hear my music very clearly I don't hear the wind, engine and can barely hear the exhaust. These things are magic. I can assure you, these are the best you can buy. Just understand that they are not 100% noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: D. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Working great!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought these on recommendation of fellow Miata owners for road trips to cut the noise down. But I've been using them nightly to aid sleep, and they really do that for me. These only bring the noise level down, you can still hear things like alarms, phone calls, etc., are very comfortable, all unlike the orange foams which cut everything out and begin to hurt after a while. I highly recommend, and will likely buy a second pair to keep in the car.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: For raves and clubs!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this same brand before but lost my pair. Ordered this one for a music festival coming up this week. They help reduce just enough noise that loud music doesnt hurt your ears but will let the music come through. I also work at a nightclub as a bartender and these probably saved my hearing since I have to be in an area where music is blasting all night long! I would recommend wearing them anywhere that has loud music for a prolonged amount of time. I can also see them working at a construction site with a lot of drilling and other noises happening.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I got these ear plugs after attending an arena bowl game and having a headache from the noise the entire next day. I tried both sizes that come with these and I was still having difficulties getting them to fit comfortably. I contacted customer service and they sent me a smaller size and I love them! I plan on wearing them to my kids swim meet this week and see if they can help with some of the loud echos and whistling.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I reached out to Eargasm and they were so helpful and provided excellent customer service!! They are sending a replacement pair :) These worked really well for the one concert I got to wear them at. However, one got knocked out of my ear and couldnt be found anywhere on the floor so I had to go the rest of the show without them in. And now I only have one ear plug and dont have $30 for a new set. I’d advise getting the connector cord if you plan on going to hardcore shows with these
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Will buy these again and again.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these I have bought. The first pair I have been using for over 2 years and these are for my daughter for when we ride the motorcycle. They cancel out the wind drone and leave my ears NOT ringing after a few hundred miles. And I can still hear traffic, emergency vehicles, the music/voices from my helmet communication system, and people near me talking. Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: ItalianJoe69

customer_reviews.title: Best ear plugs on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased at least 4, maybe 5 different types of earplugs including the Eargasm brand. I did a thorough investigation to see if I could find a pair of earplugs that were less than Eargasm's price of $34.99: I just ended up wasting time and money. Yes, Eargasm earplugs are ridiculously expensive. They can get away with it because they are truly the only brand worth buying. I bought my first pair in early 2018 and they have stood the test of time—just bought my second pair last week. They are worth the money. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Oliver

customer_reviews.title: A bit painful
customer_reviews.text: They don't stay in the ear canal when you put a helmet on so you have to stick your fingers into the helmet and attempt to push them back in. After a 2 hour ride they were excruciatingly painful causing me to go back to my old foam ones. Other than that they were good at keeping the wind noise to a minimum and the bark of my pipes at a low rumble (but so do the foam ones). I will need to try the smaller size that came with the plugs to see if there is a difference. Sorry, not so much an Eargasm; MTF.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Rogers

customer_reviews.title: What?  I can’t hear you...
customer_reviews.text: So I got these after about 25-30 years of no ear protection for live music. Unfortunately I have a nice case of tinnitus, so as not to suffer further damage, I picked these up. I just saw Korn in LA as the testing ground at the Hollywood Paladium. I gotta tell you I took these out after the show- and no ear fatigue at all. Well with the purchase price. It does block out some highs from guitar and vocals, but it’s just not worth the hearing loss. I would strongly recommend this Product if you care about your hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Bmac

customer_reviews.title: great for festivals.. specifically house and bass
customer_reviews.text: i don’t go to concerts without them now. seriously needed to invest in my ears and future by protecting my ears from all the festivals i go too. sometimes it’s a little hard to place in your ear and know that it’s fitting comfortably and streaming the sound properly. another issue would be keeping them clean. i have since lost the instructions to clean and it says do not use specific liquids so... i also end up using them for ear plugs when i sleep at camping festivals LOL
customer_reviews.author: Meris

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome for concert goers/ musicians who don't mind looking a little bit lame, in order to prevent a lifetime of tinitus. They actually do what they say, and mostly only cut out the high highs and the low lows, making concerts sound a bit quieter, but not muffled the way that normal earplugs do. The only complaint I have is they look a little silly, as there's a long piece of plastic that sticks out of your ears (so they're easy to remove), and it makes me think of Frankenstein's monster whenever I put them in; but that's cool in its own weird way, I suppose. All and all, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Great earplugs and customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I have thus far only used the standard ear plugs. These are too big for my ears but I had not yet switched to the smaller ear plugs. Besides this, the quality of the ear plugs were phenomenal! I could hear everything without feeling my ears getting damaged. I recently lost the smaller pair at a music festival along with the carrying case because they fell off the zipper they were attached to on my Fannypack. I contacted Eargasm and they replaced the smaller pair and the carrying case free of charge, and replaced them promptly. I am happy with the quality as well as the customer service of Eargasm Earplugs. I will definitely be recommending these in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Alaina M Butner

customer_reviews.title: Best Earplugs for Hard Rock Concert
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for myself and my son for his first Tool concert. I have never really been too worried about my own hearing and have often lived with the ringing and deafness that follows a very loud concert. However, after using the Eargasm earplugs I will never go to a concert without hearing protection again. The plugs fit nicely and I have absolutely no ringing or the usual deafness from loud music. They are also very discreet and barely noticeable. I strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: John S. from Easton, PA

customer_reviews.title: BEST ear plugs for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: My entire squad of friends uses them for festivals. We're all really into heavy dubstep, this protects our ears from the vibrations and subsequent migraine/ringing that accompanies them without sacrificing sound quality. We can all still have conversations at a normal tone with these in, as well as hearing the music clearly. They're also small and clear, so you can't see them when you're wearing them, which some people would appreciate. They come with a metal storage container to keep them in that has a clip. They're also easy to clean if they get ear wax or dust stuck to them. I highly recommend them to everyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Park

customer_reviews.title: 4 hr rock show. Worked well!
customer_reviews.text: Used at rock concert. Measured decibel peak around 85. I have hearing loss and tinnitus in left ear, so essential to protect it. Seemed to cut the volume by 50% yet I could hear the person next to me clearly. Don't know the science behind how this works but no ringing in my ears after the show. Good product and very handy storage pillbox. Recommend to those who need protection. Very comfortable. Not perfect but I give it a solid 4
customer_reviews.author: hansolo

customer_reviews.title: Save your hearing and enjoy the show.
customer_reviews.text: Got the plugs specifically for a loud concerts (Fog Hat) I was going to in a small venue, and they were as expected, amped up and loud. The Eargasm plugs worked fantastic, I could actually hear the concert and at noise acceptable level My neighbor, a musician, joined me, he had spent about $200 getting a set custom fitted....he was very impressed with my ear plugs and will be getting some for his children....musicians. Buy these plugs to get the case they come in, if for no other reason :) BTW, my Eargasm plugs looked very similar to the custom fitted plugs, same filter.
customer_reviews.author: Martin F. Schacht

customer_reviews.title: Just not good for me
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs filter out only the highest frequencies and seem ineffective against mid range sound. Also they don't fit with a good seal in the ear with either size. Just for the record - I am a music photographer and have used all different brands of earplugs. These just didn't work for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: CptDecker

customer_reviews.title: Makes riding motorcycles 10x more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.text: Even with a loud exhaust on my bike, these brought the overall loudness of riding down to a perfectly acceptable level. You can still hear everything and everyone, just toned down. Comfy, but can be knocked around by a helmet. They don't slide out or pop out from my experience. The carrying tube thing is super duper handy.. put it on my bikes keyfob.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not for motorcycle riding
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because a few reviews were claiming that they work very well for motorcycle riding. Um yeah no, not even close. I will say that it does work in the sense that the exhaust is not as loud but as far as the wind goes, it did very little to minimize that. Also, when putting on the helmet, it caused the plugs to shift out every so slightly. I had to really shove the plugs in to counter the movement from putting on the helmet. So I went back to foam plugs that work much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: I had a cochlear lesion many years ago, leaving me with ringing ears, unable to hear pitches in the highest ranges, & terrible pain with loud noises. I have used spongy ear plugs ever since...they really do the job in protecting my ears from loud noises, but muffle other noises & makes hearing certain ranges very difficult. I bought the Eargasm specifically to use when playing handbells. These allowed me to hear the bells much more clearly. I do wish they would remove a bit more of the loudness. All in all, I think I will be pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Grice

customer_reviews.title: They work well.  Packaging is over the top though.
customer_reviews.text: These work well to cut the db. I used to have to pull my earplugs out when the musicians were talking between songs to hear what they were saying. This last concert I left them in the whole time and they worked great. The constructive feedback I would leave is that in my judgement the packaging is way over the top for a set of earplugs. I would rather have simple packaging and a lower price. I feel like I am paying $10 just for the fancy box and the little aluminum screw together container.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love them
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love them. I got them to wear to metal shows after going to two in the same week without earplugs and having post show temporary deafness. It was hard for me to talk to my concert companion with them in, but the live music was just as enjoyable with the earplugs; I didn't feel like I was missing out on anything at all. Also, no more post concert deafness for me! I actually have recommended these to friends. They're worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Motorcyclist Perspective
customer_reviews.text: I used to use regular ear plugs for motorcycle riding but I got these so I can reuse them and they work great. Everyone has different ears so make sure you get the right ones cause my left ear closes better than my right but when I get them right they fit perfect. You can still hear things even when you’re listening to music so it’s not that quiet. My ears feel completely protected so I’m happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: You don't have to yell at me!
customer_reviews.text: These things have blocked out the noise from a Formula 1 car, various machinery, and a terrible band; but allowed me to have conversations without screaming. I've also used them for really good live music that was just too loud, and they preserved the levels pretty well. It didn't sound like the band was playing inside a Honda Civic in the lane next to me. The band sounded good; I could hear understand conversations; AND I wasn't deaf afterwards! Neat!
customer_reviews.author: G. Caulkins

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding versatility
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many types of ear protection devices over the years for motorcycle riding application. These eargasam plugs strike the best balance between noise attenuation and still letting the user communicate and listen to music that I have found. Most plugs block all the sound or don’t block much. Great product! Especially for long rides.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Cashman

customer_reviews.title: Great ear plugs, reduce volume without muffling the sound
customer_reviews.text: I am a musician who's been dealing with ringing in the ears. I have to wear ear protection at practice, but find that just stuffing my ears with regular ear plugs muffles the sound and I think even distorts the sound, making everything sound very unpleasant and rumbly. These plugs are much more sophisticated, so you get significant reduction in volume, but you still hear clearly. This is also very helpful as I want to know what my guitar tone really sounds like, so I don't overcompensate with increasing the treble.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Sweigert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I used these at a club last Friday. They did a good job of providing sound and conversation clarity without muffling things too much. I was surprised at the level of difference compared to the normal foam plugs I've used in the past. One comment, the 'demo' sound on the website does a good job of conveying the difference. It is a clear, yet muted version of whatever sound is playing in the room. I did take them out a few times during the headliners set to better immerse into the experience, had I left them in then I feel sure there would have been no ringing effects the following day.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t hear my wife snore. Used with new sound machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought a sound machine from Amazon hoping I couldn’t hear my wife snore and vicea versa. Didn’t work. Bought some foam earplugs but they knocked out sound completely from sound machine. Went on amazon and did some studying and bought the eargasms. They allowed us to hear the sound machine but not each other snoring. Best night sleep we both had in ages. Looking forward to using them at McCartney concert which will hopefully allow us to hear everything but at a lower decibel rate.
customer_reviews.author: Judge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hearing Protection
customer_reviews.text: Hearing protection was stellar. I was able to enjoy over two hours of live Rock and Roll at a local venue without making my chronic tinnitus worse. However, if you have small ears you might have problems seating these ear plugs properly. I use the smallest set and I have to carefully practice putting the ear plugs in so they were effective and didn't pop out when dancing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lowers the volume without flattening the sound
customer_reviews.text: These work really well for lessening the volume without flattening the sound! I did find the hard plastic part to be a bit too big and uncomfortable for my ears, so I probably just need to get a smaller size. At certain concerts I have noticed that it is still too loud, but I haven’t experienced any pain from noise while using these.
customer_reviews.author: BNM

customer_reviews.title: The best earplugs I've uses so far
customer_reviews.text: I have the Nonoise earplugs and I didn't liked them. The noise cancelation was not good and they hurt the ears after a while. So I ordered eargasm earplugs to replace the nonoise I have. Eargasm earplugs are so much better. The noise cancelation is by far better even though in both earplugs I have a low hiss sound when riding. The eargasm earplugs design is perfect. They sit well in the ear with no leftovers outside it that can add pressure on it or can move it while the helmet is on. The only issue is the container box. I always struggle to put them in it without making them deform inside. The nonoise box is better.
customer_reviews.author: Adir Traitel

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable but high quality
customer_reviews.text: I like the connector cord, but I tried the smaller ear plugs and they hurt because they were still too big. Pretty sad that they didn't work out because it's hard to find high quality earbuds with a cord that are also comfortable. And they are expensive, so that was even more upsetting. I'm sure they'd work for people with larger ear cancals but I have small ear canals and I wish they had a smaller option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Took me to the edge
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be honest, these eargasm ear plugs had me on the edge all night but just couldn’t close the deal. I was left wanting. I heard all manner of angelic voices that made me think I was close but then realized these are ear plugs and I should not be hearing such detail for them to be effective. Still buzzing from the eargasms, my ears were ringing as I left the venue and never stopped until the lunchtime the next day. But I still felt cheated.
customer_reviews.author: STM

customer_reviews.title: Great for death metal
customer_reviews.text: I am getting old enough that going to death metal shows without earplugs is no longer a smart choice. I wish I had found these sooner, because they actually made the concert sound better. It cleared up the muffled sound really well and made it quiet enough to be comfortable, but not so quiet that I felt like I was at an awkwardly quiet death metal show. I normally would remove my earplugs for my favorite songs, but I didn't want to do that with these. For reference, the band I saw was Suffocation.
customer_reviews.author: Tarsier

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a noisy environment and go to concerts every once and a while. I wanted something that could reduce the harmful levels of machinery and music but allow me to talk with friends/coworkers. These headphones did exactly that. They are of a good design, feel good, and come with a cool little traveling container which I looped around a belt loop. I think their product is fantastic and very well thought out!
customer_reviews.author: Alex R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for concerts - all the music, none of the damaging decibels
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a Bauhaus show in Hollywood. I normally use the foam plugs you an buy in a big jar at the pharmacy, but as anyone knows who has used that kind, you have to continually adjust them to let in even a little high end. These earplugs were comfortable - like I wasn't wearing any, and the sound was dampened without losing the high end and without sounding muddy. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P. Covington

customer_reviews.title: Good for "heavy" metal
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I read someone else's review that said "Metallica concert? No problem!", so I figured these would be fine for the shows I was going to. However, I've learned that Metallica concerts must not be that loud. My ears were dying at when I went to see Boris and Melvins. Basically - If you're going to a "heavy" metal show (Metallica, Slayer, etc) these are probably great. If you're seeing some actual heavy ass shit, forget it, just go get some cheap Mack's at the gas station.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I can hear detail when they're on and they seem to block out annoying noises. I have the Dreamcatcher in L.A. concert coming up and will be testing them fully there so hopefully these help. Went to a Twice concert with just my ears and was near death afterwards... worth it. UPDATE! These are now on my must bring list to any event or concert. The sound management and intake they produced while at the concert was superb! It was really comfortable having them for a prolonged period and none of the music felted dampened at all. On a side note Dreamcatcher was AMAZING! The girls where really amazing to see live!
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Vaca

customer_reviews.title: I’m SOLD!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these dissatisfied with another brand and thought there HAD to be better. I ride motorcycles and already have mild tinnitus from life. I read rewday’s review below and gave these a shot. I barely hear any wind buffeting and can only hear the purr of my HondaVFR800 and traffic. Tested at 85mph. Wow! I’m SOLD. I’m gonna buy another pair just so I never ride without these again! All motorcyclists who want to protect your hearing long-term... I’m very hopeful this is the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Blocks excessive noise and feedback, but you can still hear everything else.
customer_reviews.text: I love these earplugs. I have minor tinnitus and I got them for going to concerts, but i have them in my purse at all times so i can wear them if the noise around me gets too loud. I went to a rock festival that had some feedback issues and i didn't hear any annoying noises with these in, i just heard the music. The only problem I had was a little soreness after wearing them for several hours, my ear canal must be a little too small (i did use the small plugs)
customer_reviews.author: Angie Sheck

customer_reviews.title: Works great while riding my motorcycle.
customer_reviews.text: To save myself from excessive "wind noise" while riding my motorcycle, these really do the trick. Aside from working great, they come in a little metal case that you can attach to your keys. It's very small, keeps them safe and makes them extremely easy and accessible to put on and store while riding and getting off of your bike. I highly recommend this product for serving it's purpose and for it's convince.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Work exactly as advertised!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these earplugs to protect my hearing, while riding my motorcycle. I've used other, basic foam and high-end silicone earplugs in the past. The others did protect my hearing, but left all sounds extremely muffled; especially when wearing a helmet. These earplugs worked exactly as defined. They reduced all the damaging wind noise and engine noise db, while allowing me to hear cars and even other riders, while wearing the earplugs. Well worth the money to protect your hearing, and remain aware of your surroundings, while riding.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Product!
customer_reviews.text: I just had a horrible ear infection and blew out my ear drums, which made some noises painful. I could not go to public settings. This product really helped me. It blocked most of the annoying sounds, but I could still have a conversation and interact with people. Very comfortable to use. I love that they sent two sizes, you you grab what is right for you.
customer_reviews.author: MJLVA

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING EARPLUGS!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these for my fiance for Christmas, and I got myself a pair after seeing them in person. We just went to a concert this weekend and let me just say - these are AMAZING!! Not only can you have full conversations with them in, but you can also hear the music perfectly!! It blocks the damage from the loud music (we went to a metal/instrumental concert). I can't recommend these enough. I loved the comfort they provided, and the lack of migraine/ear ringing after was heavenly!! Just buy a pair and see for yourself!! You won't regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so that when I go to clubs or rollerskating, I could protect my hearing from the surrounding high volume speakers. However, besides that they were difficult to put in properly, they never felt right and the noise reduction was minimal. What made matters worse, is that not only was it difficult to hear conversation, the sound I really wanted to block was the high-pitched treble. Instead, it felt like it channeled the high pitch like an arrow into my ear, causing pain. It was better to hear the music full blast than to wear these. I'm very disappointed to say the least since these were more expensive than most. Total waste of money. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M.

customer_reviews.title: Love em, no loss of sound quality and no muffled hearing after concert
customer_reviews.text: I tried these for the first time last night at a concert. I was worried I wouldn’t be able to get the full experience because I was wearing ear plugs but that wasn’t the case! I was still able to hear everything and everyone, it was just like the volume was turned down a little. It was almost like I was having my own private experience because it made me feel like I was in my own music world. The best part was when we left the show my hearing didn’t sound muffled, it was as if I hadn’t just been to a show, and we were pretty much in front of the stage and speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had known about these earlier
customer_reviews.text: The silicone and noise reduction were just what I needed. I suffer from hearing loss from all the other concerts where I did not protect my ears enough. When I first put in the earplugs with the standard shell size, I got some noise reduction, but not as much as I was expecting. I then changed the earplugs to the smaller shell and the noise reduction was considerable. I love the little case the earplugs come in as I could wear one plug and keep the other earplug "safe" in my pocket without it getting "dirty" until it was truly needed. The hard case was terrific as I could "pat" my pocket to find the case easily. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Annette Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I spent a bit more for these
customer_reviews.text: I play in a band so I've tried other ear plugs in the low $20 range over the years but they were all pretty similar. However I decided to take a chance on these and wow what a difference. I could clearly hear musical elements that were not there when using the lower priced east plugs. Its amazing and the one of them noticed a difference in my playing being right in sync. The only knock to these is that they stick to your ear canal so they can be difficult to get in place. I'm going to try adding a little lotion to see if that helps. I'm still very pleased with the audio quality.
customer_reviews.author: Send Cash

customer_reviews.title: Not noise canceling or muffling
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these. Sleeping is a high commodity when your spouse snores. I have been using ‘Mach’s ‘ disposable ear plugs for a few years. they work very well But don’t hold up for more than a few uses. I thought these would be a a great solution. My 30 day testing period was ironically cut short and by the time I needed these , my 30 day trial was over and they didn’t even drown out the sound of my sonic care tooth brush. Not one sound was blocked with these . Even a little.
customer_reviews.author: Bellabella

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement over foam plugs
customer_reviews.text: I've been using expanding foam plugs and these are a big improvement. They don't cut off nearly as much of the high end the design allows you to adjust the amount of noise cancellation by how far you push them into your ears. There's also a little tab which makes pulling them out of your ears way easier. The last thing I'll say is that if this review was only about customer service it'd be five stars for sure. The company contacted me right away to make sure I like the product and when I asked if there was a smaller size insert they sent them out to me free of charge. I'm really glad I bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Ward

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical... but they are worth it
customer_reviews.text: I delay buying this until the last concert left my ears ringing for days... they are really comfortable i normally cant handle using ear pods for a long period of time but this did not irritate my ear canal or anything, at one point i thought they weren't like really working because it sounded really good (the sound doesn't change that much) once i toke them out i realize all the noise they were keeping out, so i recommend them
customer_reviews.author: edur0m3r

customer_reviews.title: Acoustic Assault Prevented
customer_reviews.text: I recall a time when I enjoyed the full-body acoustic experience of a live band, but those days are behind me. After a particularly bad experience at the previous concert I vowed never to go again. My wife, however, had other plans. I did some research and bought the Eargasm High Fidelity Earplugs. The sound experience and quality made the event enjoyable from an acoustical perspective. Now I just need something for my eyes to prevent blindness from all the people using their cellphones to watch instead of... watching.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Carlin

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get a good seal.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get a good seal in my ears, so they didn't work. Tried both sizes of seals but the hard filter part simply is too big. My wife tried them as well with the same result. We're baffled as to all of the good reviews, but obviously they work for a lot of people. There are other brands such as NoNoise that will work if you find that you have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: RD Grover

customer_reviews.title: Look great, Best For short term use (30min or less)
customer_reviews.text: Look great. love the carry case. My son and I sized them prior to use. At the concert 45 minutes in and my ear canal starts to ache. We had to talk quite loud to hear each other. Additionally with chewing food and popcorn they started to wiggle out a little. By the end of the concert my son(13yo) and myself couldn't wait to remove these. Foam plugs used for sleep would have been more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: TheKennedys

customer_reviews.title: Great earplugs for a musician
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to try to protect my hearing after many years of gigging without earplugs. I needed good quality earplugs that would allow me to still hear the instruments clearly - I feel like so many earplugs make everything sound muddy. These do a great job of basically just turning the volume down. I can still hear everything, it's just quieter. Well worth the money. I also wore these to a concert, and they were just as good there too. Very comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Various uses, all approved.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item mainly to wear them during my motorcycle trip from Chicago to South America, wore them for 8 hours a day with my helmet on and they were comfortable. They have two sizes which came in handy. Since there were many nights of camping outside, i also wore these while i slept. And they were fantastic, was able to get great rest and energize for the next day. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Rey

customer_reviews.title: Good for loud exercise classes
customer_reviews.text: I use these for spin cycle classes, where the music is super loud and intense. I'm always in front of the speaker and was coming out of sessions with ringing in my ears. These aren't like ear plugs—they just turn down the volume. I can hear the instructor more clearly without losing any of the intensity of the beat. When I sweat, the plugs come out a little bit, but I can press them back in pretty quickly and they stick after the initial warmup.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kunz

customer_reviews.title: Better than foam
customer_reviews.text: While clarity & price are good, the decibel level protection does not meet my needs. I am a journalist who spends almost as much time as bands at loud venues so will continue to look for some with a little bit more coverage. These were tested during a Judas Priest concert in an arena as well as an Iced Earth concert in a club. Even though these do not meet my needs, the company has a valued product that they stand behind and I think most people who may attend less events than I do, might be ok. Comfort is amazing and probably one of the best traits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Death Metal
customer_reviews.text: I wore these to a very loud heavy metal concert last week. In the past, I had two options: either I wore typical foam earplugs which protected my hearing buy ruined the sound quality of the music... OR I wore no earplugs (dont do this) and got tinnitus for 3 days and probably some long term hearing damage. These earplugs protected my hearing and preserved the sound perfectly. Sound quality was great, no ringing or pain after a 3 hour concert. They stayed perfectly in play even during a few mosh pits. One problem: the name. The name of this product is so stupid. Why would you call your earplugs that???? Change the name and these would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Are these reviews fake?
customer_reviews.text: I am starting to not trust amazon reviews anymore. How this got to almost 5 star reviews really blows my mind. They are very comfortable alright. But they block basically no sound. Maybe they are better suited for swimming but I do not consider this as noice cancelling at all. Add in the price, and this is just really absurd for what you get. Returned them.
customer_reviews.author: KrayzieJ

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a few months and they work pretty well, they just don't stay in my ears. I think I have small ear holes or something, even the smallest ear bud cushions hurt me normally. These don't hurt but they just don't stay in at all and stick halfway out my ear. I'm a live sound engineer and use these at concerts and stuff, sometimes at work I use them and the fact that they slip out can sometimes be useful to check the actual level of the audio, so it works for me. But for anyone else with small mutant ear holes you might want to look for a smaller ear plug.
customer_reviews.author: Sister Blue

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets for the wife and I. Turns out we must have small ear canals as they just didn’t fit comfortably. I contacted the company through their chat and they offered to send two new sets for free. I even offered to pay but they insisted. The new sets fit us both perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ruel

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. Quieter sound without sacrificing sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've been going to more concerts lately and I didn't like the crappy foam ones that muffle the sound. These work great, I'm trying to save my hearing if I can a little bit, I'm 21 so I have a lot of concerts ahead of me. There's something about a concert about the extremely loud sound that I actually do miss a little bit, but these definitely lower the sound without sacrificing quality. Easy to clean and stay in my ears without any problem at all. Even at low volumes it still sounds good, I could hear my friends talking.
customer_reviews.author: unkwn

customer_reviews.title: Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. I use these when riding my bike long distances. This helps drown out noises, but they back out over time and don’t provide as much noise protection as in the beginning. Talking will cause them to back out within seconds or minutes. I could still hear my radio, and it did mute or tone down the wind noise.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: These will not stay in my ear, they always slide out. I bought these to use while I ride my motorcycle, but they have ultimately failed that purpose. I made sure they were properly inserted and no matter what I did they would always wiggle loose. When they were in my ear, I did not feel that they sufficiently blocked enough noise either.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I wore them for the first time at a G3 concert (very loud rock guitar). I was on 2nd row in front of the stacks. It was 3.5 hour of very high db music. The sound was great with the earplugs in. Others next to me had their fingers in their ears or normal plugs and commented how they were muffled. Not me. It was crystal clear. Usually, after a concert, I have a headache and ears are ringing for days. With this, I was feeling great, and no ear ringing at all. I will wear these to every show going fwd.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit into my ears (almost 6'' young adult)
customer_reviews.text: I'm a musician, and after years of being exposed to loud music/noises, I'm very sensitive to loud noises. After looking for any kind of protection, I naturally found that the Eargasm earplugs are a highly-reviewed option for hearing protection so I ordered them. For my surprise, they didn't fit well into my ears! I tried for several days to make them fit but they always squeezed out of my ears after seconds of being inserted (I tried with the two sizes included). Luckily I got a refund! If you are highly concerned with having size problems, go for the Vibes earplugs, I ordered them after the eargasms and they fit amazingly well into my ears (three sizes are included)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Palacios

product_meta.title: Eargasm High Fidelity Earplugs for Concerts Musicians Motorcycles Noise Sensitivity Conditions and More (Ear Plugs Come in Premium Gift Box Packaging) - Blue
feature_bullets: PROTECT YOUR HEARING from harmful noise levels at loud events. Cut out excess sound from everyday life and your favorite activities.

PRESERVES SOUND QUALITY with our patent pending innovative attenuation filters. Reduces noise evenly to maintain the full spectrum of sound while protecting hearing. Won’t muffle music or voices as foam plugs do.

GET THE PERFECT FIT with two pairs of different sized earplug shells included with every order. Fits most normal to large ear sizes. Insert the included pair of attenuation filters into preferred shell size and earplugs are ready for immediate use!
HYPOALLERGENIC PLUSH SILICONE earplug shells are non-toxic and comfortable for prolonged wear. Won’t cause itching or pressure pain. Ideal for all-day wear at festivals and long band practices.

ERGONOMIC ALUMINUM CASE is over 35% shorter than competing brands for easy storage on your keychain. An anti-stick interior guarantees earplugs will always be easily removable. Waterproof rubber seal ensures their protection from moisture, dust and debris. Threading is uniquely placed on exterior of canister to prevent damage to earplugs when opening and closing.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
